build_chart.description: Foresters PlanRight uses a unisex height/weight chart (imperial units) to assign one of three simplified‐issue rate classes: Preferred, Standard, or Basic. Any weight outside the minimum/maximum for a given height results in decline. Intentional weight loss over the past 12 months may be added back to current weight for final class assignment.

tables.title: Foresters PlanRight Height/Weight Build Chart
tables.measurement_unit: imperial (height in feet/inches; weight in pounds)

medical_conditions.description: Each medical condition is mapped to available coverage classes—Preferred, Standard, Basic—or decline ('No Coverage') based on recency, severity, and treatment status. The

conditions.guideline: Any assistance required from anyone to perform ADLs (feeding, bathing, dressing, toileting, medication management) → No Coverage.
Any history of AIDS, AIDS Related Complex, or HIV → No Coverage.
Diagnosed, treated, or advised to receive treatment within past 2 years → Basic Death Benefit class. Otherwise classification per other health factors.
Any history of Alzheimer's, dementia, or significant memory loss → No Coverage.
Any history of ALS (Lou Gehrig's) → No Coverage.

conditions.condition: Amputation due to Complications of Diabetes
conditions.guideline: Any diabetes‐related amputation → No Coverage.
Diagnosis within 2 years or any unrepaired aneurysm → Basic. Diagnosis >2 years ago and repaired → Standard or Preferred (depending on other factors).
Within 1 year → Basic; within 2 years → Standard; beyond 2 years and resolved → Preferred if other factors favorable.
Preferred class if treated and no recurrence; otherwise Standard.
Any history of bone marrow transplant → No Coverage.
Diagnosis within 2 years or not removed → Basic; removed >2 years ago → Standard.

conditions.condition: Cancer (other than single, treated basal cell)
conditions.guideline: Any active cancer or >1 occurrence or recurrence history → No Coverage; diagnosis or treatment within past 3 years → Basic; >3 years ago and clear → Standard or Preferred depending on type, stage, and follow‐up.
Any history of cardiomyopathy → No Coverage.
Within 1 year → Basic; within 2 years → Standard; >2 years ago and confirmed stable → Preferred.
Any chronic bronchitis or COPD diagnosis → Standard.
Any chronic lung disease (pulmonary fibrosis, cystic fibrosis, TB, etc.) → Standard.
Any COPD (including emphysema) → Standard.
Within 1 year → Basic; within 2 years → Standard; >2 years and stable → Preferred.
Any history of cirrhosis → Standard if stable; decompensated or recent → No Coverage.
Any history of CHF → No Coverage.
Implanted within 1 year → Basic; implanted within 2 years → Standard; >2 years and stable → Preferred.
Any diagnosis of dementia → No Coverage.
Advised but not completed within past 12 months or results unknown → No Coverage.
Diagnosed, treated, or advised to treat within past 2 years → Basic; >2 years ago and stable → Standard or Preferred per other factors.
Any history of emphysema → Standard.
Any end-stage disease (permanent dependency) → No Coverage.
Within 1 year → Basic; within 2 years → Standard; >2 years and stable → Preferred.
Any heart failure or cardiomyopathy → No Coverage.

conditions.condition: Heart Procedure (valve surgery, bypass, angioplasty, pacemaker, etc.)
conditions.guideline: Within 1 year → Basic; within 2 years → Standard; >2 years and stable → Preferred.
Any history of hepatitis B or C → Standard.
Currently receiving or advised to receive home health care → No Coverage.
Currently receiving or advised to receive hospice care → No Coverage.
Usage within 2 years → Basic; >2 years ago and no other issues → Standard or Preferred per other factors.
Had or advised to have within past 12 months → No Coverage; >12 months ago and stable → Standard.
Any chronic kidney disease or renal insufficiency → Standard.
Any chronic liver disease → Standard.
Any significant memory loss or MCI → No Coverage.
Any diabetic nephropathy → Basic if recent; Standard if longstanding and controlled.
Current resident or advised to move into nursing/skilled facility → No Coverage.
Any history of organ transplant → No Coverage.
Use of oxygen equipment within 12 months → No Coverage; CPAP/Nebulizer for sleep apnea excluded from 'oxygen equipment.'
Implant within 1 year → Basic; implant within 2 years → Standard; >2 years and stable → Preferred.
Able to perform all ADLs → Standard; otherwise → No Coverage.
Diabetic neuropathy (long-term, controlled) → Basic; mild, stable neuropathy → Preferred or Standard per other factors.
Any history of PH/PAH → No Coverage.
Any history of chronic kidney disease → Standard.
Any diabetic retinopathy → Basic.

conditions.condition: Skilled Nursing Care (in home by RN/LPN)
conditions.guideline: Currently receiving or advised to receive skilled nursing care → No Coverage.
Within 1 year → Basic; within 2 years → Standard; >2 years and stable → Preferred.
Any history of SLE → Standard.
Any terminal diagnosis → No Coverage.

conditions.condition: Tobacco Class (any nicotine use within past year)
conditions.guideline: Any tobacco/nicotine use → Tobacco Class (see tobacco_guidelines section).

conditions.condition: Unexplained Weight Loss (>10 lbs in past year)
conditions.guideline: >10 pounds unexplained loss in past year → No Coverage.
Permanent use due to chronic illness or disability → No Coverage.

laboratory_requirements.description: No laboratory tests, bloodwork, or paramedical exams are required—PlanRight underwriting is fully simplified issue (aside from height/weight build chart and a short medical questionnaire).

risk_classes.description: PlanRight assigns one of three simplified‐issue risk classes—Preferred, Standard, or Basic—based on build‐chart placement and medical conditions. There are no table ratings.

classes.name: Preferred
criteria: Height/weight within PlanRight Preferred column of build chart (page 3)
No disqualifying medical conditions within specified lookback periods (per medical_definitions, pages 4–9)
Well‐controlled chronic conditions (e.g., treated basal cell skin cancer; repaired aneurysm >2 years ago; hypertension on ≤2 medications)
Age and face amount within allowable limits (inferred from whole life standard offerings; see Company Policies section)
Non‐tobacco use (no nicotine in past 12 months)

classes.name: Standard
criteria: Height/weight within PlanRight Standard column of build chart (page 3)
Medical history qualifies under standard terms (e.g., past stroke >2 years ago; stable COPD; treated atrial fibrillation >2 years ago)
Tobacco users (any nicotine/dipping in past 12 months) are automatically Standard, provided no disqualifying conditions
Stable chronic conditions (e.g., controlled diabetes on oral meds; hypertension on >2 meds but no hospitalizations)
Age and face amount within allowable limits

classes.name: Basic
criteria: Height/weight within PlanRight Basic column of build chart (page 3)
Medical history includes moderate risk factors (e.g., cancer treated 1–3 years ago; recent drug or alcohol abuse; heart procedure within past year)
Requires short‐form medical questionnaire only (no labs/APS)
Age and face amount within limited bands (per whole life common limits)
Tobacco users with additional moderate conditions still eligible at Basic.

tobacco_guidelines.description: Any tobacco or nicotine use (cigarettes, cigars, pipe, chewing tobacco, vaping) within the past 12 months places an applicant into the Tobacco Class (i.e., Standard underwriting class). Occasional marijuana use is treated as non‐tobacco only if <4×/week or <16×/month; otherwise classified as tobacco users or declined.

classifications.classification: Eligible for Preferred or Standard (depending on build chart and medical history) or Basic if other moderate risk factors exist.
Automatically assigned to Standard class (no Preferred available).
Considered non-tobacco for age 18–75; otherwise Standard if other risk factors present.

financial_underwriting.description: PlanRight does not require formal income verification at application, but face amounts are guided by self-reported income multiples. Underwriting relies on self-reported income to ensure face amount is suitable relative to need.

special_considerations.description: Additional underwriting factors that may result in decline or manual review include pending diagnostic tests, recent hospitalizations, severe weight loss, or high-risk avocations. See 'Medical Definitions' (pages 4–9) for full listing.

factors.guideline: Any diagnostic test advised within past 12 months and not completed (results unknown) → Decline.
>10 lbs unexplained weight loss in past 12 months → Decline.
Permanent use due to illness or disability → Decline.
Currently receiving or advised to receive home healthcare or hospice care → Decline.
Any end-stage, terminal diagnosis expected to cause death within 12 months → Decline.
Any history of organ or bone marrow transplant → Decline.
